### Describe the feature you'd like to request

Amplify's Figma to Code is quite pleasing. But this feature is limited to react only.
When this will be available for cross-platform frameworks like react native, iconic and swift UI?

### Describe the solution you'd like

When can we expect this feature?

### Describe alternatives you've considered

.

### Additional context

_No response_

### Which Specific Feature is your question related to?

amplify studio

### Question

I was trying to deploy my models but it shows me this error: "Cannot push Amplify environment "staging" due to missing Lambda function environment variable values. Rerun 'amplify push' without '--yes' to fix. - Function DailyReminderNotification is missing values for environment variables: USER_TABLE"

### Describe the bug

Hello, I am using figma to react code in Studio with data binding, everything was working as expected, until I added a 2nd data model with a one-to-many relationship. The collections in my UI Library in Studio still display properly in Studio, however, when I amplify pull the updated data models and UI components Locally I receive the following error:

✖ Failed to sync the following components: ReviewCardCollection

My two data models are "Products" and "Comments", the relationship is: One Product to many Comments. It is the UI components/collections connected to Product which are failing on amplify pull.

 "dependencies": {
    "@aws-amplify/ui-react": "^4.2.1",
    "@next/font": "13.0.7",
    "aws-amplify": "^5.0.7",
    "eslint": "8.30.0",
    "eslint-config-next": "13.0.7",
    "next": "13.0.7",
    "react": "18.2.0",
    "react-dom": "18.2.0"
  }


### Expected behavior

ReviewCardCollection to successfully pull down into my local environment  

### Reproduction steps

1. Create 2 Data models with a one-to-many relationship in studio 

2. Bind Data to the Figma component in studio (bind Data to the model of the "one" end of the relationship, not "many") 
- For Example, My two data models are "Products" and "Comments", the relationship is: One Product to many Comments. It is the UI components/collections connected to Product which are failing on amplify pull.

3. run Amplify pull

### Describe the bug

I have created and deployed a data model in amplify studio and created a form component under UI Library. Then I run amplify pull --appId ______ --envName staging and all my amplify files are pulled (i.e. aws-exports.js and /amplify) however the /ui-components folder is not pulled into my /src directory as expected. 

### Expected behavior

After pulling from amplify studio, the /ui-components folder should be pulled into my /src directory as expected. 

### Reproduction steps

1. Create a data model in amplify studio
2. Customize the auto-created form under UI Library in amplify studio
3. Run amplify pull --appId ____App ID______ --envName staging in your projects main directory
4. See /amplify and aws-exports.js added but not the /ui-components folder

### Project Identifier

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

Where do I create this file so that it can be loaded into this path:
C:\Windows\System32\amplify\backend\backend-config.json

I am getting an error when trying to pull the backend down saying file doesn't exist at this location. I have saved and deployed my data model.

### Which Specific Feature is your question related to?

Amplify Studio

### Question

I have a lambda that deploys the typical put_item(), triggered by the addition of a new item in the same DynamoDB table that I am adding to.
```
client
   .put_item()
   .table_name()
   .item()
   ...
   .send()
   .await;
```
Note: 1) The `.item()` only exists for the required fields of the table 2) the primary key is a custom string

From Dynamo DB Console, I can confirm that the new item is added.

However, when I check the same table in Amplify Studio, I do NOT see the new item, while I get (5 transactions failed to sync). After manually adding the fields left empty from the console, it now shows "3 transactions failed to sync".

Where can I find the information to debug this? 

ADDITIONAL INFO;

 - Nothing is in CloudWatch
 - Updates to existing items - not added by the lambda - are correctly reflected to Amplify Studio Console

### Describe the bug

In the form builder UI, i can generate an update form from a Data Model containing AWSJSON type fields, and it appears correct while setting it up (i.e. the sample data appears in the text area field as a JSON string. However, when i use the generated React component, I get [object Object] instead of the JSON.

### Expected behavior

The text area field in the generated update form should show the JSON string and not [object Object].

### Reproduction steps

1. Create a data model with AWSJSON fields
2. Create a Form Builder update form from the data model
3. Add the generate form component to a React page, and load it with a previously created record that contains valid JSON in the fields
4. The form will load with [object Object] in the text area field

### Project Identifier

_No response_

### Additional information

Looking at the generated React component, the issue appears to be the `resetStateValues` function. The individual useState hooks for each JSON field set their initial values with a JSON.stringify - e.g.
`const [bodyConfig, setBodyConfig] = React.useState(
    initialValues.bodyConfig
      ? JSON.stringify(initialValues.bodyConfig)
      : undefined
  );`
This doesn't seem to be used though, `initialValues` is a const that just has undefined values for each field. The actual values from the record that is retrieved are set via the useEffect hook which runs resetStateValues, and this function doesn't include a JSON.stringify when it sets the values, e.g.
`setBodyConfig(cleanValues.bodyConfig);`

If i change it manually to add that in myself, the form works:
`setBodyConfig(JSON.stringify(cleanValues.bodyConfig));`

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**
UI Library



**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**
I want to bind some newly added fields of types "Int" and "Boolean" from my data model to my component. The fields do not show up in the prop dropdown in UI Library.

comments.body:
@floriankrueper , It looks like we can show those options without breaking render, so we'll implement that.
However, be advised that certain types are not supported as `value` and `defaultValue` by ui-react, so you might get unexpected runtime behavior.

![Screen Shot 2022-09-21 at 09 58 49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73264629/191566819-e515d88b-a12a-484c-9f76-4dc556f1207e.png)

If you would like a component to accept more types for these props, please open an issue with ui-react: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-ui

Setting to pending release

### Describe the bug

I wanna use Admin UI with data modeling.

But when I open data tab and click "Enable DataStore and deploy" button, popup appears and there is only infinite spinner with "Checking for running deployments".

I can not use this anymore.

### Expected behavior

Continue with "Save and deploy" and update my data model with Admin UI.

### Reproduction steps

1. Make new amplify app
2. Add auth, api
3. Go to "admin-ui-management" page
4. Enable admin ui
5. Open admin ui page via "start studio" button on [Backend environments] tab
6. Click data tab
7. Click Enable DataStore and deploy button

### Additional information

I can show you what log appears when I enter admin ui page.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43214327/187142824-62c47a22-6831-4c12-b5d3-6a7e5fb54bee.png)

_No response_

### Describe the bug

Hello Team,

As per the recent announcement with respect to Lambda function.

```
We are ending support for Node.js 12 in AWS Lambda. This follows Node.js 12 End-Of-Life (EOL) reached on April 30, 2022 [1].

As described in the Lambda runtime support policy [2], end of support for language runtimes in Lambda happens in two stages. Starting November 14, 2022, Lambda will no longer apply security patches and other updates to the Node.js 12 runtime used by Lambda functions, and functions using Node.js 12 will no longer be eligible for technical support. In addition, you will no longer be able to create new Lambda functions using the Node.js 12 runtime. Starting December 14, 2022, you will no longer be able to update existing functions using the Node.js 12 runtime.

We recommend that you upgrade your existing Node.js 12 functions to Node.js 16 before November 14, 2022.
```

Amplify studio creates the following functions with Node.js 12 runtime.

	amplify-login-verify-auth-challenge
        amplify-login-define-auth-challenge
	amplify-login-custom-message
        amplify-login-create-auth-challenge

There are two issues here.

1. Amplify studio should generate Node.js 14.x or Node.js 16.x runtime Lambda functions.
2. Also, What are the best steps to migrate already existing functions to Node.js 14 or Node.js 16 runtime ? In case toggling it off and on is the only option, what if I have many users in my Cognito "amplify-backend-manager" user pool ?

### Expected behavior

Amplify studio should create Node.js 14.x or Node.js 16.x runtime Lambda functions.


### Reproduction steps

1. If you have enabled Amplify studio in the past, check the Lambda function with name mentioned above.
2. If not, try enabling Amplify studio and wait for it to create Lambda function with Node.js 12 runtime.

### Additional information

_No response_

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
From AWS Amplify discord
@bruckertt

> Hey all, I am trying to use the Figma design how can I connect the feature 1x4 to have multiple records from my datastore retrieved. I can only make it work when I create a collection within Studio but is there a way to have the 4 elements with different records from the datastore?

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Preview data should randomize records used from datastore rather than use the same record for each attribute.

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**
Amplify's UI library



**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**

When I try to configure components with datastore disabled I am not able to see any of the tables or the data contained in them to connect to the components, when I try the same thing with datastore enabled it works.
Is there some step I should be doing in my case?
Is there a way to use it with GraphQL?

Note: The reason for disabling data store is the inability to edit data instances using GraphQL queries without the version number.

Google Chrome ### Describe the bug I can't go back to Visual editor error says "an unsupported directive: @index" But I have not edited the schema in any way other than from visual editor. Now I have to edit from schema.graphql and do `amplify push` ### Expected behavior When only editing using the Visual editor I should always be able to move back to using visual editor. ### Reproduction steps Move to GraphQL Schema. Work on you project, amplify pull. Eventually when you come back to Data side menu, you are not able to go back to Visual editor. ### Additional information _No response_

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**

Amplify Studio - Data - Data Modeling shows a message below.
 "GraphQL Syntax Error. Syntax Error: Unexpected <EOF>. Something is wrong with your GraphQL schema. [Open an issue ](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/issues)for the Amplify Studio team to investigate." 


**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**
I updated graphql from local machine and tried to push it several times but it was getting "deployment failure" and then lost data model visual tables and graphql schemas.  But dynamoDB tables are existing

comments.body: Hi @Simoneth - if you disable and reenable Amplify Studio via the Amplify console, then the user pool gets recreated and then you can re-log in. Toggle this setting off and on again.

Microsoft Edge

### Describe the bug

Auth does not set custom headers when I authenticate user

I am using vue and nuxtjs to build a static website

I authenticate the user using the following code: 

`async SignIn({ commit }, payload) {
        try {
            const user = await Auth.signIn(payload.EmailPhone, payload.Password);
            payload.username = user.challengeParam.userAttributes.name
            payload.user = user.username
            console.log(user.getSession())
            commit("SignInMutate", payload)
        } catch (error) {
            console.log('error signing in', error);
        }
    },`

Which works i.e. I get an object returned such as the following:

`CognitoUser {username: 'T', pool: CognitoUserPool, Session: 'X', client: Client, signInUserSession: null, …}
Session: X
authenticationFlowType: "USER_SRP_AUTH"
challengeName: "NEW_PASSWORD_REQUIRED"
challengeParam: {userAttributes: {…}, requiredAttributes: Array(1)}
client: Client {endpoint: 'https://cognito-idp.eu-west-2.amazonaws.com/', fetchOptions: {…}}
keyPrefix: "CognitoIdentityServiceProvider.Y"
pool: CognitoUserPool {userPoolId: 'X', clientId: 'X', client: Client, advancedSecurityDataCollectionFlag: true, storage: Storage, …}
signInUserSession: null
storage: Storage {length: 0}
userDataKey: "F"
username: "Y"
[[Prototype]]: Object`

However when I then make api calls to my datastore or try to get the authenticated user I get errors stating that the current user is not authenticated.
 

### Expected behavior

User gets custom header with JWT token included and this can run api calls which require authentication

### Reproduction steps

authenticate a user in my pool.
then make an api call that requires an authenticated user.

### Additional information

here is my aws export js contents:

    "oauth": {},
    "aws_cognito_username_attributes": [
        "EMAIL"

        "EMAIL",

    ],

    "aws_cognito_mfa_types": [
        "TOTP"
    ],
    "aws_cognito_password_protection_settings": {
        "passwordPolicyMinLength": 8,
        "passwordPolicyCharacters": [

            "REQUIRES_SYMBOLS",
            "REQUIRES_UPPERCASE"
        ]
    },
    "aws_cognito_verification_mechanisms": [

    ],
    "aws_appsync_graphqlEndpoint": "T",

};


export default awsmobile;

Login works.

Attempt to open amplify.

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**
Amplify Studio

**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**
I have AmplifyAdmin permissions, however when I attempt to open the Amplify Studio, I am redirected as if I do not have sufficient permissions.

Users with full AWS admin permissions can access the Studio, so I would surnmise that I must be missing a further permisison.

**Which permission do I need to access this resource via my AWS Account?**



I have sufficient permissions to invite  myself as a non-AWS user, and login to the studio via email/password, sop am using that workaround for now, but that is not a sustainable / manageable solution.
It was also extremely frustrating to work out as a solution.

-----

On a related note, some level of AWS::CloudFormation::Stack permission appears to be required to VIEW the backend status in AmplifyConsole->MyApp->Backend->deploymentStatus .  Without that permisison, I just see a loading spinner, when other users could see that the site has deployed.  AWS admin granting me "full" AWS::CloudFormation::Stack permissions allows me to see the successful deployment message.

Mac ### Browser type? Chrome, Safari ### Describe the bug users who have the "Manage Only" role created in Amplify (under App settings: Amplify Studio settings), were put in a redirect loop and could no longer access Studio. It appears authentication succeeds, but then just loops to this screen: If you select the backend, it just reloads with this screen. Looking at console, we could see a couple 403 errors: After changing the `Access Level` in Studio settings for the user from `Manage Only` to `Full Access` we were able to again login without issue. When I change it back to `Manage Only`, we again can no longer login. It appears there is some permission error with `Manage Only` access level that was introduced within the past 2 weeks. ### Expected behavior We should be able to login without error using the `Manage Only` access level ### Reproduction steps 1. Assuming a user was already created prior to 2 weeks ago in Studio Settings, goto App settings: Amplify Studio settings 2. Ensure the user has `Manage Only` access level set 3. copy the URL of the environment to login to 4. Open another browser (or close this one and reopen no longer logged into aws) 5. goto the copied url 6. attempt to login 7. you should see a screen similar to the one above ### Additional information _No response_

### Please describe your bug.

I'm new to Amplify and I try to use Amplify Studio UI design to create a form. I followed this instruction https://docs.amplify.aws/console/uibuilder/override/#save-form-data

But when I tried to override the onChange or onClick handlers, I couldn't pass the type check and got the below message.

Type '{ Image: { src: string; }; Upload: { onClick: () => void; }; TextFieldName: { onChange: (event: any) => void; }; TextFieldAddress: { onChange: (event: any) => void; }; ButtonSave: { onClick: () => void; }; }' is not assignable to type 'EscapeHatchProps'.
  Property '"Upload"' is incompatible with index signature.
    Type '{ onClick: () => void; }' is not assignable to type 'Record<string, string>'.
      Property 'onClick' is incompatible with index signature.
        Type '() => void' is not assignable to type 'string'.

Then I traced the code and noticed the below code in https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-ui/blob/main/packages/react/src/primitives/shared/utils.ts 

```javascript
export type EscapeHatchProps = {
  [elementHierarchy: string]: Record<string, string>;
};
```
After changing Record<string, string> to Record<string, any>, I could pass the check and run the application well.

### What's the expected behaviour?

Pass the type check.

comments.body:
Hi @abhi7cr ,

Thanks!
The first bug has been found and solved.
The reason is that we use S when writing the AWSTimestamp type field, and use N to synchronize
![S_to_N](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34567144/176619419-9538b6bd-7417-4cf2-90a1-de8c369af379.jpg)
.

comments.body: Hi @hein-j I have the very same symptom, with exactly the same error message as shown above. Here's what I'm trying to do when I came across that error: After I sync UI library with Figma, I configure my UI component by selecting the button and coming to the "child properties" at the right of Amplify Studio to set the following properties: - Prop: onClick - Action: Create new - Model: VehicleProfile (just the name of my own data model used in my project) Then under Model field names, I populate the fields by matching text fields on UI to Model field. The error occurs while I match one of the text fields on UI to data model fields. I would noticed the preview of the component gone with message "SyntaxError: No-Inline evaluations must call `render`" came up in place. Once this error pops up, Amplify studio is unable to render the UI component again. The only way out of this error, is to delete the component from UI library, then make some change in Figma and re-sync. However, it was pretty consistent that when I repeat the steps above again, the error will come back. I suspected it was either a field in my data model or a text field in the Figma design that offended the component rendering process in Amplify Studio. I mocked around the data model fields and text fields, and came to realized that it was one of the fields in my data model, being named "model". Since my data model is about vehicle and one of its fields "model" might be a reserved word. I can't say that's the cause of the original complaint above but for better developer experience I'd be preferred to be told about reserved words to avoid as field name. Now I used capitalized word "Model" as the field name in my data model and have not ran into the error again.

### Describe the bug

Hi,
 
I do develop  a mobile application in Flutter using Amplify Studio, The pictures used in application are taken by Amplify File Browser(S3).
To add data to Amplify File Browser, I click the "Create Folder" button and fill inside. During this process,  I've noticed that some data is lost when data grows.
All of the data have been added are visible on the S3 side, but some of the data are  not visible on the File Browser page. I can not get any  results when searching to find the folder I have added  on the File Browser page. And at the same time when I check on S3 side, I can see that the folder has been added there.
 
Kind regards..

### Expected behavior

The data I add from the File Browser page in Ampplify Studio is registered to the S3 side and this data should appear on the File Browser page.

### Reproduction steps

1. Open Amplify Studio
2. Click the File Browser tab
3. Press the "Create Folder" button
4. Name the folder
5. Click Enter and create the folder
6. Add data to folder
7. Check S3 to see if data has arrived
8. Check the File Browser page to see if data has arrived

### Additional information

We get this error when we try to add data from the File Browser page in Amplify Studio. The data we add sometimes comes to File Browser and sometimes it doesn't. The data we add is always visible on the S3 side.

### Describe the bug

I have followed the tutorial to set up a react-amplified application from here:
https://docs.amplify.aws/start/q/integration/react/?sc_icampaign=react-start&sc_ichannel=docs-home

Issue: 
- I have added 3 todo entries through the React form: https://dev.d2i2pjhnjm5k6t.amplifyapp.com/
- I have then enabled Amplify Studio
- I've clicked on Manage -> Content in Amplify Studio
- I got the message that 6 todos failed to sync
- None of the todos are displayed in the content section, but they are in the DynamoDB table
- When I add a new Todo through the Manage -> Content form, it will be added, also to the DynamoDB table
- The Todos that I've added previously over the web interface, however, won't show up in the Content section.

The GraphQL schema looks as followed:

```
type Todo @model @auth(rules: [{allow: public}]) {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  description: String
}
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6489758/162232259-9955fa01-1d00-49f6-ad64-10e2abc2f04e.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6489758/162232328-2594f6a5-05f6-4d47-af08-0ce6d7405231.png)




### Expected behavior

- All todo's should be listed in the Manage -> Content section of Amplify Studio
- There should not be an error message that 6 todos failed to sync

### Reproduction steps

1. Follow the react-amplified tutorial on your website: https://docs.amplify.aws/start/q/integration/react/?sc_icampaign=react-start&sc_ichannel=docs-home
2. Add 3 todos over the web interface once you've published the application.
3. Enable Amplify Studio over the AWS Amplified Web Console.
4. In Amplify Studio go to the Manage -> Content section.
5. You should then see the sync error and no data.
6. You should be able to add a new entry, which will also be written to DynamoDB.
7. But you still won't see the previously added entries.

### Additional information

_No response_

### Describe the bug

Amplify Studio, Content does show for hours:  Loading (Please wait for models to finish initializing) after creation of GraphQL type with @primaryKey on a field not named "id".

Warning message in the browser console:

[WARN] 35:14.619 DataStore - subscriptionError Connection failed: {"errors":[{"message":"Validation error of type FieldUndefined: Field 'id' in type 'XXX' is undefined @ 'onUpdateXXX/id'"}]}

The amplify push went thru nicely, no errors, the table was created fine.

### Expected behavior

Seeing data in the Content section of Amplify Studio.

### Reproduction steps

1. Create a new type in schema.graphql:

```
type Todo @model @auth(rules: [{allow: groups, groups: ["Admin"], operations: [read, create, update, delete]}]) {
  TxID: ID! @primaryKey
  name: String
} 
```

3. Do `amplify push`

2. Open Amplify Studio / Content

### Additional information

_No response_

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**
Amplify studio data modeling

**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**
I'm trying to edit the data model I recently deployed (using the visual editor), but I can only view the schema. The Visual editor button Is inactive. This is not a big blocker for my workflow, since I can edit the schema locally, but I wanted to make sure this is the expected behavior and not a bug. I think it would be really nice if the UI would allow users to visually edit the data model as well (since obviously no one gets it right the first time as we all know :) )

btw, I see a lot of this log line:
i18next::translator: missingKey en-US schemaDesign schema.parameters.singular schema.parameters.singular

Seems a little strange to me, 100 of them and counting!

Then I pulled, added an unrelated rest api endpoint to the project, and pushed! so these \@conection directives (or any other unsupported elements) were auto generated for me at some point. Hello, I have a simple two item model with a `@hasMany` relationship on `SpecificationGuide`:`Guide` (1->many) all built through Amplify Studio. It stopped working today. Here is the entire schema ``` type Guide @model @auth(rules: [{allow: public}]) { id: ID! specificationguideID: ID! @index(name: "bySpecificationGuide") region: String! parameters: AWSJSON! bucket: String key: String requestId: String start: AWSDateTime end: AWSDateTime } type SpecificationGuide @model @auth(rules: [{allow: public}]) { id: ID! bucket: String! key: String! level: String! identityId: String! Guides: [Guide] @hasMany(indexName: "bySpecificationGuide", fields: ["id"]) } type Subscription { onGuideBySpecificationGuide(specificationguideID: ID!): Guide @aws_subscribe(mutations: ["createGuide", "updateGuide"]) } ```

comments.body: We apologize for the frustration, in order to delete an Amplify backend environment and all of its associated resources, you can either use the AWS Amplify console within the AWS console, or locally with the Amplify CLI by pulling your backend environment down, and then performing a remove environment command. To delete your backend environment and all associated resources from within the AWS Amplify console, first login to the AWS console, type "Amplify" in the services search bar at the top of the page, and select, "AWS Amplify". Once the AWS Amplify console loads, select the app that you created via the Studio sandbox, and it will take you to your backend environment list page. From there, you can select the Actions drop-down on the right, and click "Delete", confirm on the next screen and this will remove the environment and its associated resources.

comments.body: Sorry to hear @namwkim - in order for the change to be applied after you switch the default auth mode, you need to click the "Back to Data Modeling" link: and then click the orange "Deploy" button to perform a save and deploy to update the auth mode.

body:
If I try to modify the data model and deploy it from the Amplify Studio, the deployment will fail if any of my Lambda functions have environment variables specified. Fails with the following error:

Cannot push Amplify environment "test" due to missing Lambda function environment variable values. Rerun 'amplify push' without '--yes' to fix. - Function stripefunc is missing values for environment variables: PUBLIC_URL. 

To work around this issue, I must delete the environment variables locally, push changes to the cloud, deploy the data model changes in Amplify Studio, pull the changes, add the environment variables back, and finally push the changes back to cloud.

### Describe the bug

The Amplify Studio interface does not seem to allow for adding redirect URLs that use custom URLs protocols (e.g. `myapp://login/`). You CAN however add such a URL just fine via Amplify CLI.

### Expected behavior

Validation behaviour between the Amplify Studio interface and the Amplify CLI should be identical. Both should easily allow you to add URIs that use custom protocols.

### Reproduction steps

1. In Amplify Studio, visit the "Authentication" Section
2. Add an Oauth login mechanism (Google for example).
3. In the "Sign-in & sign-out redirect URLs", try entering a URL with a non-HTTP protocol (e.g. `myapp://login/`)
4. You will receive this frontend validation error: `Must use https:// or http://localhost or {app_url}://`
5. Meanwhile, adding the exact same URL using the CLI via `amplify auth update` works just fine (and even shows up fine in Amplify Studio afterwards).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7507516/152671844-15b71db3-7d26-49c6-bf30-71bff8f20d86.png)



### Additional information

This issue caught me off guard at first as the validation message itself - even if it _was_ working correctly - is a tad confusing. I wasn't sure if `{app_url}` was some sort of environment variable I had to set somewhere else. It took me a while to realise `{app_url}` was just meant to indicate you could freely enter a custom protocol.

Ideally, if this bug were fixed, the validation messaging could also be refined to potentially be more explicit in saying, hey, feel free to use any custom protocol here.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...]
 Not able to see the name of the data when trying to connect to an existing data in Amplify studio.

Please find the below models:

type ContentRule @model @auth(rules: [{allow: public}])
  @key(name: "byCAPTemplate", fields: ["template", "name"])
  {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  order: Int
  alwaysInclude: Boolean
  rule: String
  content: CAPContent @connection
  template: ID
}

type CAPContent @model @auth(rules: [{allow: public}]) {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  content: String
  type: CAPContentType
  result: CAPContentResult
  result_color: CAPContentResultColor
}

The content is 1 to 1 relationship in the ContentRule model.

It would be great to show the name of CAPContent when trying to link existing CAPContent in the ContentRule model. But currently content column of the CAPContent is showing in the dropdown and it is difficult to find the correct one from the dropdown
**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be great to have the name of the model.

### Describe the bug

When creating a model that starts with the name of an existing model that have a relationship - it will duplicate the existing relationship so the first model will now have the original relationship more than once (See Reproduction steps for more details)

### Expected behavior

Do not create duplicate relationships for models starts with a similar name

### Reproduction steps

1. Create Model named AAA
2. Create Model named BBB
3. Create an relationship between the two. (let's say one-to-many)
4. Create a new Model and start to write its name AAA (which will raise a "duplicate name" error) than add another letter to the name, lets say "B" (so we will have a new name AAAB).
5. This will create a duplicate relationship between AAA and BBB

* You can repeat step 4, and it will recreate duplicate relationships

### Additional information

Additionally, but not so related to this bug - 
When you create a connection (relationship) from model A to model B - the name of the connection in model A will start with an uppercase letter, but the connection name in model B will start with a lowercase letter - it's a bit annoying :)

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?** Amplify Studio Content

Is there a way to change what is used in the autocomplete for referenced items? To me it seems like it is taking a random field since after a schema change it suddenly became a different field.

It also seems like the search is only working on the field that is used in the autocomplete. I some more complex scenarios it might be easier if the search would span over multiple if not all fields.

      The next step, as published on the AWS Amplify website, states that within the terminal one must command 
      "amplify configure" and then one will be prompted to answer a few credential questions within the terminal.  
      My terminal does not acknowledge "amplify" as a command.  No matter what I did I can not get this to work.
      I even downloaded Microsoft VS Code and tried it in that terminal, only to find that it still doesn't receive the command.

Please help.  It is frustrating how this simple CLI set-up problem is hindering major progress.

### Describe the bug

When deleting data from the Amplify Studio UI, the data does not get deleted from the corresponding DynamoDB table(s).

### Expected behavior

Data should get deleted

### Reproduction steps

1. Click on the "Create <object>" button
2. Fill in the form
3. Click on the "Save <object>" button
4. Confirm data is in DynamoDB
5. Select that same object
6. Click on Actions -> Delete items

Object no longer shows in Amplify Studio, yet the data is still in the DynamoDB.

### Additional information

I've also experienced the opposite behavior, where I create new data using the "Auto-generate data" feature, but the progress indicators keep on turning and data is never actually created.

### Describe the bug

The UI is stucked in "Deploying..." for quite a long time (now more than half an hour). I was trying to deploy a graphql api as described here https://docs.amplify.aws/cli-legacy/graphql-transformer/relational/ with a single table.

The single still "running" activity is "jobCategory.GenerateBackendAPIModels".

I've tried to `amplify push`again and it shows the following error message: "Failed to get credentials: Token is inactive". The same when I issue `amplify pull`. Did an `amplify configure` again and still the same "token is inactive" message.

Also deleted the folder, did again an `amplify pull ...` and it worked back. Edited the Api and again stuck on the same thing.

I am worried if it would increase the cost of the deployment.

### Expected behavior

It should finish the deployment and allow to continue working with the tool.

### Reproduction steps

1. Follow the guide: https://docs.amplify.aws/cli-legacy/graphql-transformer/relational/
2. Reaching to "Push your project to AWS with amplify push."
3. Everything broke.

### Additional information

_No response_

### What operating system are you using?

Mac

### Browser type?

Chrome

### Describe the bug

If you follow the tutorial for adding support for Cognito Triggers (https://docs.amplify.aws/guides/functions/cognito-trigger-lambda-dynamodb/q/platform/js/), the Content UI breaks for the newly created User model. You are presented with an error message "2 users failed to sync". 

### Expected behavior

I expect the tutorial for adding users from a Cognito Trigger to not break the Content Management UI screen. I would also expect there to be a mention of what fields are required for the Content Management UI (https://docs.amplify.aws/console/data/content-management/) screen to function, as updating a model directly in Dynamodb via a lambda trigger is not uncommon. 

### Reproduction steps

1. Follow the documentation for this feature exactly: https://docs.amplify.aws/guides/functions/cognito-trigger-lambda-dynamodb/q/platform/js/
2. Trigger the lambda function to add a new user to the table
3. Go to the Content Management UI screen and select the User model. You should see an error.


### Additional information

To resolve, add _version and/or _lastChangedAt to your lambda function.

```javascript
    let params = {
      Item: {
        id: { S: event.request.userAttributes.sub },
        __typename: { S: "User" },
        email: { S: event.request.userAttributes.email },
        createdAt: { S: date.toISOString() },
        updatedAt: { S: date.toISOString() },
        _version: { N: "1" },
        _lastChangedAt: { N: Date.now().toString() },
      },
      TableName: process.env.API_{YOUR_APP_NAME}_USERTABLE_NAME,
    };
```

comments.body: Hi @letsbelopez, Alright... so by looking at the screenshots etc. I was going to send, I found that the component property in my component UI had the same name as the entity. ("BBQ"). I did try to rename it but it did not work. I did try to make some changes on the original component but nothing solved the issue... So maybe a good replication scenario would be to: - Create a component - Use the component with a property having the same name as the entity - Confirm that it does not work - _But from what I understand, it now should actually work because it has been fixed._ - Try to change the property name to be different from the entity name - See if it fixes the issue or if the issue remains. I think for the time being, we can close this issue. Philippe

### Describe the bug

Currently many functions (hang with the status of "Checking for running deployments", endless loading content/ data) cannot be used because of a JSON.Parser ( `const jsonSchema = JSON.parse(schema)`;) error exists in the function "setSchemaAuthAttributes". The error is in the **schema** string itself (from request "**getModels**" in object "Models"), because there was inserted "// Generated using amplify-cli-version: 7.6.5, amplify-codegen-version: 2.26.21\n\n". Once this is removed again, everything should work. Please check and correct.

### Expected behavior

No parsing error.

### Reproduction steps

1. open home of adminui
2. navigate to content or data
3. endless loading circle

### Additional information

_No response_

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I had a very large datamodel. Suddenly, the "save and deploy" button went disabled. Could not save. When page reloaded, all the model was gone.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Make saving of the model auto save, even though that does not mean deploying it. It could be like the autosave feature, and you could then navigate through different versions.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

### Describe the bug

For the past week, I've been trying to update my data model in the "data modeling" section of the Amplify backend UI. However, after adjusting my model, I select the "Save and deploy" button in the upper right corner, to which the typical screen loads with the message, "Are you sure you want to deploy all changes made to your schema?". The button continues to hang with the status of "Checking for running deployments", and will not actually deploy the new data models that I've created.

### Expected behavior

I've been working with the Amplify UI for three months now, and before the past week, I didn't have any issues clicking the button, deploying the new schema and model, and then working with it locally.

### Reproduction steps

1. Go to "Data" on the left-hand window of the Amplify UI to adjust the data model for the particular AWS Amplify backend app.
2. Adjust the data model and select "Save and deploy".
3. This should trigger the bug.

_No response_

comments.body:
Same here, appID `dqxz9invx10sl` in `us-east-1`, `dev` environment, but pushed/deployed model changes with the CLI (7.6.5). In my case I am also seeing some javascript errors:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7280187/148235827-e2c08bcb-fa1a-45fd-af02-94595e441141.png)
I have another environment `devtest` that should have the exact same model definition and that one doesn't have this issue (haven't tried to go past the Save and Deploy dialog point since I am afraid that I will break that one also, but at least it appears that it would allow me to deploy and there is no error in the dev tools console.
I have been debugging it a bit and my guess is that it could be an issue with the response from getModels since that is the last network call for the broken `dev` env. Compared the responses from the two environments and the only difference is that the broken one has an extra commented line in the JS response saying `Generated using amplify-cli-version: 7.6.5, amplify-codegen-version: 2.26.21`, see below:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7280187/148242313-55a680e1-99ad-4a71-b586-a3084abeba7b.png)
The response seems to be from the "src/schema.js" that is generated by the CLI (it could be a CLI error?), so tried manually updating it on local and publishing again, but no luck.
I feel this is a really small fix, so please help!

I have another environment `devtest` that should have the exact same model definition and that one doesn't have this issue (haven't tried to go past the Save and Deploy dialog point since I am afraid that I will break that one also, but at least it appears that it would allow me to deploy and there is no error in the dev tools console.
I have been debugging it a bit and my guess is that it could be an issue with the response from getModels since that is the last network call for the broken `dev` env. Compared the responses from the two environments and the only difference is that the broken one has an extra commented line in the JS response saying `Generated using amplify-cli-version: 7.6.5, amplify-codegen-version: 2.26.21`, see below:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7280187/148242313-55a680e1-99ad-4a71-b586-a3084abeba7b.png)
The response seems to be from the "src/schema.js" that is generated by the CLI (it could be a CLI error?), so tried manually updating it on local and publishing again, but no luck.
I feel this is a really small fix, so please help!

After pushing, go to the Amplify Studio, "Data" page, observed the models are rendered as below screenshot: Noticed that `RecipePost` has a field `blog` with type `CookingBlog`. This seems incorrect, as normally, there is no way to assign a Model as field type via the type dropdown menu of a field. Further more, when clicked "+ add field", it added a new row in the relationship section instead of the field section, and the UI started failing. ### Describe the bug

Whenever I'm trying to configure Amplify for pulling the env from Amplify Studio, this error pops up when validating the authentication. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12515425/146682012-5ff6f64a-2dc0-4ca8-8cf2-35ec1f6db789.png)



### Expected behavior

Authentication being successful and then able to pull the details from env.

### Reproduction steps

+ Use the command prompted by Amplify Studio to configure and then authenticate the user.
+ On click of verify `yes` as prompted on the browser, it shows the error message.

### Additional information

Tried it first on Brave, then saw there is already an issue with it https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/issues/278 so tried on Edge which is also a Chromium based browser and has the similar experience.

### Is this feature request related to a new or existing Amplify category?

api

### Is this related to another service?

AppSync, OpenSearch

### Describe the feature you'd like to request

Amplify Studio should provide an option for making the models searchable and thereby stream the model data into OpenSearch, It should also generate search queries that will read the model data from OpenSearch.


### Describe the solution you'd like

Every model should have an option to make it searchable in the Data modeling phase of the Amplify studio. If the `searchable` option is checked, the deployment of that model should enable streaming of that model data into OpenSearch. It should also generate search queries for that model that read data from OpenSearch.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

The Amplify CLI already provides a way to make a model searchable using the @searchable directive.
https://docs.amplify.aws/cli/graphql/search-and-result-aggregations/

comments.body:
> The `@hasOne` and `@hasMany` directives do not support referencing a model which then references the initial model via `@hasOne` or `@hasMany` with DataStore enabled.
> 
> To mitigate an issue with an unsupported DataStore graphQL schema using the `@hasOne` or `hasMany` directive pointing to a model that refers back to itself with either `@hasOne` or `@hasMany`, please execute the following steps.
> 
> 1. Pull your project locally with model generation disabled by running `amplify pull --appId {appid} --envName {envname} --no-codegen` where {appid} is your app id and {envname} is your backend environment name
> 2. Update your `schema.graphql` file, and ensure that no models circularly reference each other via `@hasOne` and `@hasMany`. You can update `@hasOne` to `@belongsTo` as shown below.
> 3. Push back to cloud with `amplify push`
> 4. After `amplify push` completes, refresh the Amplify Studio page before deploying again.
> 
> ## Unsupported DataStore Schema Example
> ```graphql
> type Blog @model @auth(rules: [{ allow: public }]) {
>     id: ID!
>     posts: [Post] @hasMany(indexName: "byBlog", fields: ["id"])
> }
> type Post @model @auth(rules: [{ allow: public }]) {
>     id: ID!
>     blog: Blog @hasOne
>     postID: ID @index(name: "byBlog")
> }
> ```
> 
> ## Supported DataStore Schema Example
> ```graphql
> type Blog @model @auth(rules: [{ allow: public }]) {
>     id: ID!
>     posts: [Post] @hasMany(indexName: "byBlog", fields: ["id"])
> }
> type Post @model @auth(rules: [{ allow: public }]) {
>     id: ID!
>     blog: Blog @belongsTo
>     postID: ID @index(name: "byBlog")
> }
> ```

Application is being built for iOS 15.

Error in the application: 
```
Error getting all doctors outer -- APIError: failed to process graphqlResponseData
Caused by:
DataStoreError: Could not parse 2022-01-19T09:24Z as a Date using the ISO8601 format.
Recovery suggestion: Check if the format used to parse the date is the correct one. Check
`TemporalFormat` for all the options.

I believe swift is expecting something like `2022-01-19T09:24:00.00Z`

same, and noticed that error appears after adding many to many relationship to my tables

This can happen when field types on models with a many-to-many relationship change or the many-to-many field itself is renamed or changed from not required to required and there is already existing data in your app's underlying DyanmoDB join table(s). DataStore sync's will begin returning errors, which prevents DataStore from fully initializing, which then prevents the Content page from loading. As a temporary workaround, if you aren't seeing actual errors in your developer console (most of these screenshots), you can see which model is returning a sync error using the "Network" tab in the Chrome or Firefox developer console. Open the "Network" tab and reload the Content page, after it finishes loading, filter on "graphql", there should be a sync request for each of your models. Look at the response and an error message will be present for at least one of the models. You can then go to the corresponding join table in DynamoDB for your many-to-many relationship that is failing to sync (it will be in that "Network" response) and delete any records in this table with missing values. The join tables require values from each model in order to sync properly. Refresh the Content page and DataStore sync will begin working again. It's in our backlog to automatically detect and provide a better, automated solution for when this type of behavior occurs.

> This can happen when field types on models with a many-to-many relationship change or the many-to-many field itself is renamed or changed from not required to required and there is already existing data in your app's underlying DyanmoDB join table(s). DataStore sync's will begin returning errors, which prevents DataStore from fully initializing, which then prevents the Content page from loading. > > As a temporary workaround, if you aren't seeing actual errors in your developer console (most of these screenshots), you can see which model is returning a sync error using the "Network" tab in the Chrome or Firefox developer console. Open the "Network" tab and reload the Content page, after it finishes loading, filter on "graphql", there should be a sync request for each of your models. Look at the response and an error message will be present for at least one of the models. You can then go to the corresponding join table in DynamoDB for your many-to-many relationship that is failing to sync (it will be in that "Network" response) and delete any records in this table with missing values. The join tables require values from each model in order to sync properly. > > > > Refresh the Content page and DataStore sync will begin working again. It's in our backlog to automatically detect and provide a better, automated solution for when this type of behavior occurs. The bottom line is that I just created tables, there was no data in them. I removed everything and created a new Amplify project with same DynamoDB structure and immediately after creating the tables, the same error appears, and the same output in the console. If look at the network: all 3 tables are loaded correctly without items in them (can be seen in the screenshots). But besides this, there are 12 more requests that contain this: Too long for a screenshot, so I'll write in text: **_{"data":null,"errors":[{"path":null,"locations":[{"line":10,"column":7,"sourceName":null}],"message":"Validation error of type FieldUndefined: Field 'chatroom' in type 'ChatRoomUser' is undefined @ 'syncChatRoomUsers/items/chatroom'"}]}_** @cslogan-red may be you have new ideas after my comments?

> @AlexeSemenenko your particular schema is still sometimes a problem for DataStore itself, we've seen this with reverse m-m relationships (many to many on both sides of a model) when one model also has a 1-m relationship, like in your example. The sync error preventing DataStore from initializing is also the same type that I explained above. Behind the scenes, many to many relationships create a join table in DynamoDB, in this case `ChatRoomUser`, and the sync is failing because at least one record exists in that join table without the `chatroom` side of the join populated. You can make sure either side of your m-m relationship is not required in your schema via Data modeling and then "Save and deploy" if so, otherwise look for a record in that underlying `ChatRoomUser` DynamoDB join table without one side of the join populated and delete it. > > We have this tracked in our backlog as an upcoming release to provide the ability to continue syncing your other models even if one model fails to register properly with DataStore (like in this case), so that you can at least save data in your other models until the sync issue is corrected. Checked not required and redeployed - nothing has changed. In DynamoDB have the following picture: Or I misunderstood something? _(sorry that the problem is not being solved)_

comments.body:
@crazymonk The root cause of the Cognito error is that the email for which you are trying to reset password has not yet been verified. We offer a way to verify it through Admin UI. 

First, click on the email in the Users table.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18372698/144955387-7d6a6acb-9b00-434c-bdb5-f50f8c51ad02.png)

Then mark is as verified in the view below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18372698/144955487-6cdce043-228e-4e29-bb0a-55309696e09b.png)

You should now be able to reset password on the user. Please let us know if this works for you.

Then mark is as verified in the view below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18372698/144955487-6cdce043-228e-4e29-bb0a-55309696e09b.png)

You should now be able to reset password on the user. Please let us know if this works for you.

Hi,

This is my first time using Amplify. I have set up my frontend, deployed and hosted my website successfully. After adding the Backend environment for Authentication & API, I was unable to link my project on local to the backend service had created through the AWS Amplify Console. I have tried running amplify pull --appId {appId} --envName {envName} as per instruction, however, the console is showing this error. `\amplify\team-provider-info.json' does not exist`

I have tried numerous solutions from online but none of them worked. 

This seems to be the closest to the issue that I am facing: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-cli/issues/3274 
Encountered this issue too:
`Upon issuing amplify init though, it does not ask Do you want to use an existing environment? as shown in the documentation - it proceeds to create a new project in Amplify Console with the same name as the old one.`
The solution in 3274 did not work for me as well.

Would be great if someone can help me with this issue! 

Thanks & Regards
Lyra

I can add the services ID, team ID, key ID, and private key with no problems. 

When I try to add the sign in/sign out redirect URLs I experience a problem.

I'm trying to add `com.carbn.Carbn.test://`but I get an error message: 
`Must use https:// or myapp:// or http://localhost`

This validation forces the input to be restricted to be literally writing the word "myapp" instead of the actual app ID. 

When using the CLI, you can correctly put one's own App ID and it appears as such in the Admin UI later. 

This issue makes the Admin UI broken for the purposes of SIWA. 

### Expected behavior

Expect the validation to not reject custom app IDs outright. 

### Reproduction steps

1. Attempt to add SIWA using Admin UI 
2. Attempt to put in redirect URL 
3. Come crying to Github

_No response_

comments.body: Sorry to hear about the struggles @drclohite - apps initially created locally with earlier CLI versions (pre ~4.2) can have environments wind up in conflicting states when the older CLI version continues to be utilized locally but is always patched to latest in the Amplify build system, we have automatic & manual migration paths and warnings for this but there may still be cases/configurations that are not caught. Since you mentioned your `dev` environment initialized successfully automatically, you should be able to use the env clone feature within AWS Amplify Console to clone the resources to a net-new environment with the latest configuration and CLI, and once it finishes, you can run an `amplify pull` to pull that environment down locally. (The command will be available to copy under "Local setup instructions" once the clone completes) If you login to the AWS Amplify Console and go to your app and the `dev` backend environment tab, go to Actions > Clone and provide a net-new environment name and confirm.

body:
**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**

User Management in Admin UI


**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**

Hi,
I like the possibility to edit user data in the Admin UI. That makes things way easier. 
Unfortunately the Admin UI only shows 4 user attributes for me. I think these are the attributes that I set as mandatory as I created the cognito store.

My question now: Is it possible to edit all other parameters including custom attributes in Admin UI? The Chrome Developers Console shows that all the attributes are coming from the api call but they are not listed in the interface.

BR and thanks in advance for answers

comments.body:
Hi @dbeck121 , were you able to resolve the issue? I was able to add the following sign up attributes in **Authentication** page and was able to edit them for an user in Admin UI:

 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5371802/144687588-23df9b5f-103b-4ae8-af14-b40353717437.png)

We don't  support custom attributes at the moment.
Thanks for the fast answer! I ignored that because I am not able to change after deploy. Is there any workaround?

Any help is appreciated.

**Describe the bug**
When I go to the Amplify Admin Dashboard and go to the Content tab I try to create a dataset for a model that is related with another model, it won't create. Following error appears when clicking on "Save model": "Unable to save changes, please complete required fields and try again." None of the fields that are missing are required or marked as red. Also the relatedModelID field is missing in that model. When I go to the initial model and click on "Create & link to a new model", the same error appears.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the "Amplify Admin Ui"
2. Go to "Set up / Data"
3. Click on "Add model"
4. Call it "Model 1"
5. Add a random field to "Model 1" (string, int, doesn't matter)
6. Click on "Add model"
7. Call it "Model 2"
8. Add a random field to "Model 2" (type doesn't matter as well)
9. Go to "Model 1"
10. Click on "Add a relationship"
11. Name it "Model 2"
12. Related to "Model 2"
13. Cardinality "1:n One Model 1 to many Model 2"
14. Go to "Model 2"
15. Click on the "Model 1 ID" field
16. Check the checkbox on the right for "is required"
17. Save and deploy the models
18. Go to "Manage / Content"
19. Create a "Model 1" (should work)
20. Now click on the newly created model
21. Scroll down to the "Model 2" relation buttons
22. Click on "+ Create & link to a new Model 2"
23. Fill in the required fields
24. Click on "Save Model 2"
25. Error: "Unable to save changes, please complete required fields and try again."

**Expected behavior**
It should save "Model 2"

comments.body: Hmm, I can't reproduce this, "Manage only" login admin users can still display existing app users without issue: It's possible you've created your app's user groups manually via Cognito and imported them into Admin UI? You can confirm your admin user is part of the "Manage-only" Admin UI user group by opening Cognito in your app's region, navigating to the user pool `amplify_backend_manager_appId` and looking at the `Manage-only` user group, any admin login users you specify from Amplify Console as "Manage only" will appear here. Users you create through Admin UI will be added to your app's default Cognito user pool (`appname-envname`) without an associated group, and these users will list in Admin UI for both Full-access or Manage-only admins, if you've manually created Cognito pools or groups within those pools, you need to import them into the CLI user the `auth import` command.

I haven't created my app's user groups manually, it was created automatically by amplify cli, probably by using `amplify add auth`. Regions in Cognito, Amplify and Admin UI are the same (eu-central-1). I see my Manage Only user in the correct group in Cognito, but still, only Full Access users can see the app users in Admin UI.
![User-Pools-Amazon-Cognito (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2624540/131810751-975ef7ba-83b1-4e51-90a9-0f624cb6ac6e.png)

comments.body: @24jr please definitely raise this as an Authentication feature request with the [amplify-js](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js ) team if you feel it's relevant! I'm more just confirming the functionality as it pertains to the AdminUI developer experience, this is expected behavior. In your example, you can actually utilize the AdminUI console to search for and find that user (if they have any idea what they changed email was) and manually force a reset for their password, or, update and verify their email address to the correctly spelled version on their User profile (Set up > User management): The Authentication docs in this case provide an overly simple example to get you started, but in your own app, you do not have to call `Auth.updateUserAttributes` in order to initiate this flow, and could instead build your UI around [initiating an attribute update first](https://aws-amplify.github.io/amplify-js/api/classes/authclass.html#verifyuserattribute) and then submitting, only calling the update after this submission with the new email address is successful. Please reopen if you encounter any further issues specific to the AdminUI console that we can clarify, thanks!

### Describe the bug

When suspending or reactivating an account, the confirmation box prompts:


> By continuing, you're confirming that the above account(s) will be suspended[/reactivated]. THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE.


This is incorrect, because you can undo an account suspend by reactivating the account, and vice-versa.

The scary warnings (and the need to manually type "Suspend" or "Reactivate") are overkill for these operations.

### Expected behavior

When suspending or reactivating an account I would expect the confirmation dialog box to simply state:

> By continuing, you're confirming that the above account(s) will be suspended[/reactivated].

Along with buttons for "OK" and "Confirm suspend[/reactivate]" without requiring manual typing for confirmation.

### Reproduction steps

1. Navigate to User management
2. Activate the checkbox next to a user
3. Select Actions -> Suspend or Actions -> Reactivate

### Additional information

_No response_

On the other hand if I **delete** manually the entry from DynamoDB web, it dissapears from AppSync query but the entry still exits in Amplify AdminUI/content web. At least it is a symmetrical bug.

WARNING: if I **update** (not delete) the entry in any DynamoDB or AdminUI/content, the change is propagated to the other (I think this is working well).

I expect all the AWS products working together as a whole, should't I?.

type Users @model @auth(rules: [{allow: private, operations: [create]}, {allow: owner}]) {

[...]

The course of action: - Created a new branch `production-test` - Added new environment with `amplify init` called `prodtest` - Tried adding hosting to this new environment with `amplify add hosting` but failed with `Amplify Console hosting has already been enabled`. `amplify status` says this new environment already has auth. I don't understand why. I literally just initialized this environment. - I saved the changes with `amplify push` to see if I could add hosting to this environment later - Still cannot add hosting, so I add it through the console and notice my `prodtest` branch hasn't been pushed to GitHub yet. I push it, try adding hosting again through the CLI, still doesn't work, so I add it using the Console. - Testing this new branch's frontend (same production code still connected to the old backend), a new registration still shows the wrong template for the verification code email, as expected: - Deleted and re-added auth using the Admin UI - Ran `amplify pull` to have this `production-test` branch connect to the new `prodtest` backend - Observed the `aws-exports.js` file change as expected, commited the new changes and pushed to GitHub. This triggered a new frontend build, as expected, connecting the frontend code to this new backend. - Testing this new branch's frontend, now connected to the prodtest backend, a new registration still shows the wrong template for the verification code email: So it seems Admin UI has a bug. I'm leaving this environment up and running until this issue is resolved or closed.

The course of action: - Created a new branch `production-test` - Added new environment with `amplify init` called `prodtest` - Tried adding hosting to this new environment with `amplify add hosting` but failed with `Amplify Console hosting has already been enabled`. `amplify status` says this new environment already has auth. I don't understand why. I literally just initialized this environment. - I saved the changes with `amplify push` to see if I could add hosting to this environment later - Still cannot add hosting, so I add it through the console and notice my `prodtest` branch hasn't been pushed to GitHub yet. I push it, try adding hosting again through the CLI, still doesn't work, so I add it using the Console. - Testing this new branch's frontend (same production code still connected to the old backend), a new registration still shows the wrong template for the verification code email, as expected: - Deleted and re-added auth using the Admin UI - Ran `amplify pull` to have this `production-test` branch connect to the new `prodtest` backend - Observed the `aws-exports.js` file change as expected, commited the new changes and pushed to GitHub. This triggered a new frontend build, as expected, connecting the frontend code to this new backend. - Testing this new branch's frontend, now connected to the prodtest backend, a new registration still shows the wrong template for the verification code email: So it seems Admin UI has a bug. I'm leaving this environment up and running until this issue is resolved or closed.

I created a clone environment of master (which is fine at the moment) and modified a model and deployed. Comparing the activity between the broke and the good - every action except "Update API" has a "running" & "completed" step...it seems like the root stack ("amplify-[app name]-[env]-[#####]" isn't circling back to set "Update API" back to "done".

### Describe the bug

I have several environments which have a GraphQL API, yet the Amplify console "Data" section does not show my model, instead there is a button prompting to "Enable DataStore and deploy". In the past we figured this was some kind of bug and have just clicked the button and moved on.

What's happening now is the deployment is failing, and the console error message is unhelpful:
> ValidationException - An error occurred while processing your request: ValidationException: null.

![Screen Shot 2021-07-22 at 11 13 17 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39595102/126664542-f71b80a9-b384-4cf7-b2f6-54693ee77f07.png)


### Expected behavior

I expect it to be not necessary to deploy datastore in console when I've added a GraphQL API to my project and defined some models.

But if I must, for whichever reason, I expect the deployment to succeed and for the data modelling tool to be available to me with the models I've defined.

### Reproduction steps

1. Create a new environment
2. Add a GraphQL API
3. Define a model
4. Push
5. Check the "Data" section in console
6. Click "enable datastore and deploy"

### Build Settings

_No response_

_No response_

### How did you install the Amplify CLI?

npm

Mac

### Amplify Commands

pull

### Describe the bug

I'm attempting to "Enable DataStore and deploy" within the Amplify Admin UI Console under the "Data" section. I have auth and api (GraphQL) plugins enabled. Social logins were set up with the amplify cli and show up with the correct key/secret pairs in Cognito, but I'm getting the following error from the Admin UI upon deployment:

`auth headless is missing the following inputParams googleClientId, facebookAppId`

Here's the full error code:

```
Command failed with exit code 1: /root/.amplify/bin/amplify pull --amplify {"envName":"dev","defaultEditor":"code","appId":"d3pxrgvb8lbj8z"} --providers {"awscloudformation":{"configLevel":"project","useProfile":true,"profileName":"amplify-backend-processor"}} --frontend {"frontend":"javascript","framework":"react","config":{"SourceDir":"src","DistributionDir":"build","BuildCommand":"npm run-script build","StartCommand":"npm run-script start"}} --yes

I can't find a place to add environment variables within the Amplify Console because my project is a react native project without a frontend deployment.

I tried running `amplify update auth` and readding my keys for facebook and google sign ins, but still had the same issue in the Admin UI Console after `amplify push`.

### Expected behavior

I expected to be able to deploy changes via the Amplify Admin UI Console. Instead, deployments are failing because it can't seem to pull in my social login keys.

### Reproduction steps

1. Initialize Amplify
2. Add Auth with social login
3. Add API (GraphQL)
4. Enable Admin UI
5. Try to "Enable DataStore and deploy" under the "Data" section

### Describe the bug

When cloning an app, if the initial push was aborted, then the app is incomplete and cannot be used. It cannot even be deleted.

Error message in Admin UI:

> Deletion failed ValidationException - An error occurred while processing your request: ValidationException: null

### Expected behavior

Regardless of whether the push was successful or not, at the very least, the app should be able to be deleted.

### Reproduction steps

1. Run `amplify init --app git@github.com:<github-username>/<repository-name>.git`.
2. During the "Initializing project in the cloud..." step, press Ctrl-C to abort.
3. Go to Amplify console, e.g. https://console.aws.amazon.com/amplify/home?region=us-east-1#/d12345abcd
4. Try to delete the app.
5. Try to delete any of the app's environments.

body:
**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**

graphql mutations


**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**

I would like to update a data object with the aws-amplify api and see that if we are using the Datastore, we need to pass the current _version of the object into the mutation or else the mutation will not overwrite existing fields as desired. See https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-android/discussions/289 
 
So, I am wondering what is the recommended way for the client to fetch the latest version number? My first instinct is to run a get query first to get the _version parameter. Is there a better way? It seems silly to execute a fetch query and then a mutation every time we want to overwrite data. 

If there is no better way and it is recommended to run a fetch first to grab the _version of the object, then why does my fetch result in the error message:     `"Cannot return null for non-nullable type: 'Int' within parent '<query name> ' (/<query name>/_version)"`?

By the way, because I ran into this error, I ran two update mutations consecutively as a workaround, pulling the version number from the response of the first update mutation (which as expected does not overwrite data), and using this version number in the second update mutation (which then succeeds in overwriting the data). This seems like bad practice and is surely not recommended.

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**
Notifications



**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**
Hi, I'm trying to add push notifications to a flutter app. I see that notifications are part of javascript and other languages, but I don't see documentation for it for flutter.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I am currently using custom vtl resolvers for input validation. An error will be thrown if the 'name' field is empty / blank (contains only spaces) / contains more than 255 characters. 

When I try to create a new InvestmentManager and enter name as " " (space), I am able to click save and the modal window closes. The creation fails as expected with a red cross. However, the error message from my custom resolver is not displayed on the Admin UI. The error message is displayed in the developer console instead. This poses inconvenience for users when they are trying to add new data using the Admin UI as they are unable to see the error message from the custom resolver. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85095477/124741177-02a8eb80-df4e-11eb-802c-16a47d34a1ec.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85095477/124741825-b4481c80-df4e-11eb-89a7-1adba0e471d9.png)



**Describe the solution you'd like**
Display error message from custom resolvers on the Admin UI instead of just showing a red cross. For example,
![Screenshot 2021-07-07 182136](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85095477/124743796-a8f5f080-df50-11eb-8558-3aebb71e4a36.jpg)

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I simply want to see the number of users in my user pool. Currently the team has to check the user pool with the attribute "Estimated number of users". 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Show the estimated number of users within user management in the amplify admin console. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
The alternative is to give team members proper IAM permissions to only check the cognito user pool.

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**
graphql



**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**
I would like to fetch  a list of users from my database using graphql and the aws-amplify api for javascript. My query uses cognito authorization and appears to succeed. However, the data response is an empty object. Why is this?

Please point me to a working example that makes a graphql fetch using the AWS-amplify API and then console prints or captures the response. 

Note that the query in my AWS Appsync dashboard returns the expected list of users.

`      API.graphql({
        query: listUsers,
        authMode: 'AMAZON_COGNITO_USER_POOLS',
      }).then(
        console.log('fetched user list'),
        (response) => (this.data = response),
        console.log('this.data: ' + JSON.stringify(this.data)),
      ).catch(error => console.log('error: ' + JSON.stringify(error)))`

### Before opening, please confirm:


- [X] I have [searched for duplicate or closed issues](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/issues?q=is%3Aissue+).
- [X] I have read the guide for [submitting bug reports](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports).
- [X] I have done my best to include a minimal, self-contained set of instructions for consistently reproducing the issue.

### App Id

du3xfq2ykwgzd

### Region

us-west-2

### Environment name

prod

### Amplify CLI Version

4.51.0

### If applicable, what version of Node.js are you using?

v14.4.0

### What operating system are you using?

Mac

### Browser type?

firefox

### Describe the bug

The content pane with my multi-auth api is working great in my dev env, great work!! The content pane in prod gives me the "error loading your data" message however. I noticed the following differences in console ouputs:
- dev shows a successful listUsers call
- prod shows no listUsers call and shows the following warning: `[WARN] 05:17.435 DataStore - subscriptionError Connection failed: {"errors":[{"message":"Validation error of type FieldUndefined: Field 'serviceSubscriptionID' in type 'ServiceRequest' is undefined @ 'onCreateServiceRequest/serviceSubscriptionID'"}]}`

Hello
Can I see in my account how many api requests are being processed in real time? 
For example, when starting the application

When we create our data models in AWS Amplify Admin UI (e.g. blog data model) we are encouraged to have separate tables for the Blog, Post, and Comment models. Under the hood, the data models in AWS Amplify Admin UI will create DynamoDB tables. 

When we query a blog post we also want to get all its comments. Would this not create unnecessary overhead for queries in DynamoDB?

## Context

Based on the DynamoDB documentation [First Steps for Modeling Relational Data in DynamoDB](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/bp-modeling-nosql.html), it states that we should design our tables by first observing the access patterns of our application rather than to normalize our data models. It also states that we should generally maintain as few tables as possible.

Hello,

My app was working fine but now when I go to Setup>Data and hit Save and deploy button I'm getting a Deployment
failed message. I deleted and recreated the app but again getting the same error.

appID: d3hya4nbukcen2
Region: us-east-1
env: dev

![Screen Shot 2021-07-04 at 23 27 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7637236/124410326-91d0bc00-dd20-11eb-8b4d-b9b6c39b01ec.png)

So I deleted and recreated one more time using CLI, but this time I created only one model just to make it simple and try to find out if it was a problem with my code, but got the same error.

Following below the only model I'm trying to deploy:
```GraphQL
type Product @model @auth(rules: [{ allow: public }]) {
  id: ID!
  title: String!
  description: String
  image: String!
  price: Float!
}
```
