body: ### Before opening, please confirm: - [X] I have [searched for duplicate or closed issues](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/issues?q=is%3Aissue+). - [X] I have read the guide for [submitting bug reports](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports). - [X] I have done my best to include a minimal, self-contained set of instructions for consistently reproducing the issue. ### App Id d2x8y6tpqwq0qo ### Region ap-southeast-2 ### Environment name master ### Amplify CLI Version 5.0.0 ### If applicable, what version of Node.js are you using? v14.15.5 ### What operating system are you using? Windows x64 ### Browser type? Google Chrome: build 91.0.4472.101 (x64) Edge Build 91.0.864.54 (x64) ### Describe the bug ## In Short *Upon a change to a table index of the DynamoDB backend, the Content tab will no longer load. After those changes were undone, the content tab still will not load* But it works in Edge (Build 91.0.864.54 (x64)) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18284908/123186122-cfd90f00-d4da-11eb-9fae-5620c6b005da.png) - No errors in the Chrome-dev-tools pane - Network activity shows a request being sent to 'https://XXXXXXX.execute-api.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com/prod/backend/d2x8y6tpqwq0qo/job/master' every 5 seconds - status code 204: No content (info blocked out - not sure if it is sensitive) ## AdminUI Content Tab Screenshot (Chrome) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18284908/123185083-766fe080-d4d8-11eb-9f4f-40d0b914b1d9.png) ### Expected behavior When changes are made and then undone on the DynamoDB backend, the content tab in Chrome either shouldn't fail at all, or at least fail with a helpful error message. ### Reproduction steps ## Steps I made 1. Create data models using the Data tab in AdminUI, including an 'Information' data model with 4 fields. Save & deploy. (Note: no records exist) 2. Rename a field, getting prompted that all data would be cleared -> proceed. #### In the below steps, I'm trying to make a circular reference which I now understand is disappointingly a restriction of the AdminUI :( 3. Add a 1:1 relationship to another model. Rename the created field to be 'informationID'. 4. Delete the relationship, including the 'informationID' field. 5. Add a field in the 'Information' model called 'informationID' with datatype [ID]. 6. Save & deploy. Content tab works, but no circular reference. 8. In DynamoDB, manually create an index in the exact same format as the other tables: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18284908/123184878-fba6c580-d4d7-11eb-918c-5a63b836c01f.png) 9. Go back to Content tab: refresh; not loading (same error state => no errors) 10. Back to DynamoDB: delete newly created Index. 11. Content tab: refresh; still not loading. 12. Delete entire Information model. 13. Content tab: refresh; still not loading. 14. (GraphQL queries still return good data for the rest of the models) 15. ### Fix: Do all edits in Edge (In all times, I made no manual changes to the schema, apart from in the Data tab) ## Before As I said above, this happened to me the other week. So, I’ll try and remember as best as I can: 1. Once again, have the data models set up. The table is called ‘Content’ - One m:1 relationship (one Content to many) - ~12 existing records 2. In the Data tab, create a new field. Save & deploy. 3. In the DynamoDB, because it was faster, I added in the missing fields in the existing records 4. Go back to Content tab: refresh; same problem. Continuously loading, same error state, no errors. 5. after a few days, and possibly one or two deploys later, it seemed to resolve itself temporarily, for one session and then back to the same Loading state again. 6. ### Fix: - The last time, I tried to fix it by undoing adding the new field, which didn’t fix the issue - In the end, after either removing all of the records in the table or removing all of the models and redeploying, the issue was resolved. (I can’t remember which was the solution) ### Additional information ## Network Activity ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18284908/123186254-1dee1280-d4db-11eb-880e-1f68ffdc27f1.png) ## What I haven't tried - Adding back the model in question to see if it has any effect - Minimal reproduction: - See *what* changes cause this to break, adding indices (indexes), changing records, etc. - Find exact reproduction steps for this issue ## Thoughts I really don't know much about Amplify nor the AdminUI, so maybe what I'm doing here is completely silly. I understand if touching the DB isn't a valid use-case, but if some change causes the AdminUI to fail silently, it's still probably a bug. I'd like to see what is causing the issue and a potential non-damaging fix could be. This is my first GitHub issue, so please let me know if I'm doing something wrong! ## Potentially related Issue: #159 (closed) # Postscript After returning to get screenshots of the console (Chrome), it seems that there error messages in the dev-pane console, not sure if they are relevent:

comments.body:
Hi @Moutard3! I was able to reproduce this error by having two models that circularly reference each other with a 1:1 relationship. i.e.
![Screen Shot 2021-06-24 at 5 27 14 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21184871/123334764-8e178b00-d511-11eb-9be9-2d1bb5e2b634.png)

Datastore doesn't allow circular dependencies so you'll have to remove any circular references between models. We do have a ticket on our backlog to better surface this error.

comments.body:
For now, this cannot be automated on Admin UI as it would require kicking off CLIs `update auth` conditionally based on authorization rules present in the GraphQL schema during `create api` or `update api`. At the moment, we have a callout on Admin UI with instructions for configuring this through the CLI: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18372698/127406838-602ffea6-c850-45ea-a2dc-11b31edbe92b.png)


Closing this issue.

@aspittel enabled `Enable access to unauthenticated identities` on her app's Cognito identity pool and the errors went away. Seems like Auth deployments through the CLI are not enabling it. This needs a deeper dive on Admin/CLI side. Thank you @nickarocho  and @sammartinez for looking into this.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18372698/121587657-e6b33800-c9e9-11eb-8873-6737a8cb42e2.png)

### Describe the bug

In AWS Amplify I go into my app, choose Backend environments, click Open admin UI. Admin UI opens.

I've already created a one table data model with id:ID!, title:String, url:String, body:String, author:String, categories:String, postDate:AWSDate. Saved and deployed.

In the Content tab I click on Auto-generate seed data button, enter 1 row of data to generate, do not add a constraint, click the Generate data button.

The auto generated content immediately appears but the little spinning icon never stops spinning, and when you click away to, say the Data tab, then click back to the Content tab again, the data is gone. As a test I've waited for 60 minutes for the spinning icon to stop spinning, but the data never persists.

### Expected behavior

After just a few seconds (?) I expect a verification message that my seed data has been generated. When I click into a different tab and then return to the Content tab I expect the data to persist.

### Reproduction steps

In AWS Amplify I go into my app, choose Backend environments, click Open admin UI. Admin UI opens.

I've already created a one table data model with id:ID!, title:String, url:String, body:String, author:String, categories:String, postDate:AWSDate. Saved and deployed.

In the Content tab I click on Auto-generate seed data button, enter 1 row of data to generate, do not add a constraint, click the Generate data button.

The auto generated content immediately appears but the little spinning icon never stops spinning, and when you click away to, say the Data tab, then click back to the Content tab again, the data is gone. As a test I've waited for 60 minutes for the spinning icon to stop spinning, but the data never persists.

I have attempted to manually enter an item (record) and the exact same behavior is displayed, spinning icon never stops spinning and I lose my data.

### Additional information

Thank your for your attention to this issue.

### Before opening, please confirm:


- [X] I have [searched for duplicate or closed issues](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/issues?q=is%3Aissue+).
- [X] I have read the guide for [submitting bug reports](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports).
- [X] I have done my best to include a minimal, self-contained set of instructions for consistently reproducing the issue.

### App Id

d3o7oxxkslqr0g

### Region

us-east-2

### Environment name

dataexp

### Amplify CLI Version

4.51.1

### If applicable, what version of Node.js are you using?

v14.17.0

### What operating system are you using?

Mac

### Browser type?

Chrome

### Describe the bug

I am unable to access the Content Manager available in the Amplify Admin UI. 

The error I am seeing on the UI states: 
"**There was an error loading your data.
We’d love to address this issue. Please provide your console log and other details here.**"

The GraphQL schema was created using CLI and pushed using "amplify push". Once pushed, I was able to also "save and deploy" using the Admin UI console. 

After successfully being able to "save and deploy", I was able to use the content manager to create a parent entity (example: StoreLocation) and create one child entity (StoreAddress) and add the child entity to the parent entity. 

After creating these two related entities, I was no longer able to access the console. 

It seems to time out while trying to load the screen. I am able to sync with the data from my local amplify application. 



### Expected behavior

I expect to be able to continue to use the Admin UI's content manager after initial creation of relational entities. 

### Reproduction steps

1. Create Graph QL relational schema with authentication settings and generate models.
2. Push to amplify (amplify push) to deploy schema
3. Login to amplify UI and perform a "save and deploy" on your data model, in order to use content manager
4. Add content using content manager, where there is at least one parent with a child entity associated to it. 
5. Update schema by removing all authentication restrictions (@auth) and re-publish from CLI
6. Log into amplify UI and perform a "save and deploy" on your data model. 
7. Access content manager again and see error message. 

### Additional information

Chrome console log: 

[us-east-x.admin.amplifyapp.com-1622125936856.log](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/files/6554857/us-east-x.admin.amplifyapp.com-1622125936856.log)

If you're creating your GraphQL models locally with the Amplify CLI, or if you have existing models from before Admin UI was launched, your schema needs to be redeployed from within Admin UI to ensure it has all of the necessary directives that allow the Content CMS to connect to your data sources. If you don't do this, you'll end up with the behavior folks are seeing here, with the Content page unable to load. 1. **Most importantly** if you're making and pushing local model changes via the Amplify CLI, make sure that Admin UI is enabled for your Amplify Console app! Without this, we can't ensure the correct directives are applied to your models that allow the Content page within Admin UI to work. Login to the AWS Amplify Console and go to App settings > Admin UI management and ensure Admin UI is enabled: 2. Once Admin UI is enabled, open the Admin UI schema editor for your app (Set up > Data), and click "Save and deploy" to trigger a simple deployment - this will ensure that your schema is in sync with Admin UI and that it has all of the necessary directives in order for the Content CMS to work. **TL;DR**: If you're experiencing any error behavior or are unable to load the Content page for your GraphQL models, open the Admin UI schema editor for your app (Set up > Data), and click "Save and deploy" to ensure the correct directives are applied across your schema that allow the Content CMS to work.

comments.body:
Hi @apoorvatvk, to access the AdminUI, you'll need to enable/open AdminUI from app backend in the Amplify Console.

Try instead  - 

1. Run `amplify console`
2. Select the **Amplify Console** option
3. That will direct you to the environment in the Amplify Console

From there, if you'd like to use the Admin UI:

1. Go to **App settings** -> **Admin UI Management** and enable for the app
2. Got to the app backends and click the **Open in Admin UI** button (below) to authenticate in

Now, the Admin UI portal will open (without the authentication prompt) if you run `amplify console` from the CLI and select the **Admin UI** option.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/634958/117831753-e38a2800-b242-11eb-89ce-793662357e02.png)


Hope that this helps!

body:
Hello Devs,
We have a system that requires identifying the role on signup (regular signup consists of email, password, and role)
When going to providers signing like Facebook and Google, we didn't find anything related to our goal.
The scenario is, when you come to our web app, you must signup to be able to login into the system. In this case, it's possible to trigger the signup action and add the role field, to be considered later on login, So once the user login, we identify what pages to show based on the logged-in role.
But when talking about providers login (Facebook and Google) signup action is not a choice, and it's not possible to make changes to the fields, like adding role field.

My question is, is it possible to apply that scenario with Amplify?
Any suggestion is appreciated, **thanks in advance**

**Describe the bug**
According to the [documentation](https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/datastore/relational/q/platform/android#saving-relations) saving relations should be as simple as adding the related object to the object you wish to save via the builder pattern. 

However, in my experience, no such builder step method is generated for the related object. Here is my schema where Lessons and LessonComponents have a **many-to-many** relationship :

```
type LessonComponent @model @auth(rules: [{allow: public}]) {
  id: ID!
  lessons: [LessonLessonComponent] @connection(keyName: "byLessonComponent", fields: ["id"])
}

type Lesson @model @auth(rules: [{allow: public}]) {
  id: ID!
  LessonLessonComponents: [LessonLessonComponent] @connection(keyName: "byLesson", fields: ["id"])
}
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
- Create a project with the same schema as described above.
- Generate the code for android
- Attempt to call something like `Lesson.builder().lessonComponents()` <-- and notice it does not exist

**Expected behavior**
I would expect there to be a method named `.lessonComponents()` to be generated so that I can store related objects.

**Screenshots**
If my admin console screenshots would be helpful I would be happy to add them. 

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

Using AWS CLI, I imported data into the DynamoDB table which my data model is using. I ensured to include all the relevant Amplify-specific keys in the data set.

After the import, in Amplify UI Content section, I see the message **(906 events failed to sync)**

My question is, how do I find out _why_ the items failed to sync? I've searched through CloudWatch and cannot find any logs for this. I'm clearly looking in the wrong place.

I guess I've got a type wrong somewhere in the data, but I've tested in AppSync console, and I am able to query the data there without issue.

AppID: dsc1djfwcopq8 eu-central-1

Hi @azamsharp, thanks for reporting this! It seems to be a duplicate of #47. The fix for this is as follows

You need to add the generated source files to the project so they'll get compiled.

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Related to this issue https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/issues/134, I cannot login through Admin UI when I use Cloud9 because localhost server is launched within Cloud9 environment and Admin UI cannot communicate with localhost.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I want cli to show an option to manually exchange and store login token generated on Admin UI. Admin UI to show a token to copy and cli to paste the token.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I was thinking if giving a hostname on Admin UI to change where Admin UI make POST request works, but I'm not sure if it's secure enough.

**Additional context**
Cloud 9 is used in some companies and hands-on depending on their policy.

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**
The question relates to user authentication for my Amplify app

I have setup authentication with CLI command "amplify add auth" and added the flow to my web app. I have noticed that registered via web form users were not authenticated in my web application. At that, the users entered manually through Admin UI of Amplify web console were authenticated fine.

It looks that auth settings used in AWS Cognito require user email confirmation. But when I have created new user with real email and I received email with PIN code. But unfortunately my web app has no form to accept PIN codes and I don't want to use PIN-code based user-flow! My expected behavior form user is to confirm email by clicking the link in the email received by him.  Is this supported? if yes, how can I set that option in Cognito?

BTW, I have active SES, email sending service with AWS but it is seen automatically for selection in Cognito and cognito currently uses its default email service where I am not able to change the sender  emails. Why it is not available automatically for selection and how can I enable my SES service to be seen and used from AWS in Cognito?

Thank you.



**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**

comments.body:
Hello @nilyin! To switch to using a link instead of a code, find your Cognito instance for your Amplify App in the AWS Console. On the `MFA and verifications` tab, ensure that email is set to be verified. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/942415/115321836-89151480-a139-11eb-87b0-3c4edf68cd9c.png)
After saving, click on `Message customizations`. You should now have the ability to change the verification type to `Link`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/942415/115320992-beb8fe00-a137-11eb-9c83-e9d590666f2c.png)

With regards to using SES for sending email, you will need to ensure that you have verified the identity that you want SES to send emails as. In the SES console, under `Configuration` -> `Verified identities`, ensure that you have a verified entity configured. Once it is verified, it should appear in the Cognito configuration.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/942415/115321474-bca36f00-a138-11eb-8430-8926a2cd2bff.png)

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**
The issue relates to security and defense of deployed amplify back-end from losing access to it.

I was adding Auth to my web app and was fighting with auth settings. Digging deeper I have detected unrecognized Identity Pool in Cognito not used in my app and decided to delete it to avoid of possible conflicts.
It looks that this Pool had relations to my application backend, because now I cannot open Admin UI console to manage my application settings. I see " This app is not valid or was deleted." message.

I was trying both cloning environment and inviting new user to app but it didn't solve the problem.

I was also trying to make CLI command "amplify push" from my local PC to renew settings in AWS, but it had no effect.

How can I repair access to my app admin UI? I hope my work is not lost otherwise it looks like a hole in reliability of Amplify as it affected by unexpected actions (there were no clear warnings) from other users in other AWS subsystems, like Cognito

My app ID  is d24x74bs3wfjmt   (I hope it is secure to post it here). screenshot is attached

comments.body:
Thanks for reporting this issue! I was able to recreate the problem you are having and I have some steps to resolve the issue. 

If you go into the Amplify Console and select your app, in the left menu you will have a menu item called `Admin UI management`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/942415/115298039-c5cd1580-a111-11eb-9ff3-757c375ad0d6.png)

 If you click that, you can disable the admin UI and then reenable it. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/942415/115298283-22303500-a112-11eb-930a-5ba902a78712.png)

Doing this will recreate the Identity Pool and it should work at this point. Please let me know if this resolves your issue.

Thanks for reporting this issue! I was able to recreate the problem you are having and I have some steps to resolve the issue. 

If you go into the Amplify Console and select your app, in the left menu you will have a menu item called `Admin UI management`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/942415/115298039-c5cd1580-a111-11eb-9ff3-757c375ad0d6.png)

 If you click that, you can disable the admin UI and then reenable it. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/942415/115298283-22303500-a112-11eb-930a-5ba902a78712.png)

Doing this will recreate the Identity Pool and it should work at this point. Please let me know if this resolves your issue.

my region is `eu-west-1` and the appId is `d14jimdq1ztsql`.


Tried again `amplify pull` and `amplify push` in sequence just now, no errors.
Also I created an empty test model in Data in the Admin UI and deployed successfully.
But I still have the orphan field in the model and I can't delete it.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1665710/114947320-3bed2600-9e4d-11eb-8f10-f60f2320b835.png)


I can see that the graphQL declaration for the model containing the orphan field is wrong:
```
type Person @model @auth(rules: [{allow: public}]) @key(name: "byAuth", fields: ["roleID"]) {
  id: ID!
[...]
  roleID: ID
}
```

The `Auth` model in key declaration `byAuth` does not exist, neither there is a `@connection`.

body: **Describe the bug** Within the Amplify Admin UI, you used to have the ability to create an enum. That functionality does not appear to be available any more. **To Reproduce** 1. Login to the Admin UI 2. Navigate to the Data section on the left 3. Previously, within the "add model" button there was also an "add enum" option **Expected behavior** I should be able to add an enum from the Admin UI. There does not appear to be a new way to do this. **Screenshots**

comments.body: @andy-HM It moved to the field type dropdown.

body:
**Describe the bug**

I've had an existing pre-Admin UI project which I've never had any success in getting to show any Content within AdminUI. Tried again today after several months and get the same result. Blank screen and errors in the console.

The localization errors occur through out the AdminUI so they aren't specific to this error.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1674590/114759846-95bef480-9d56-11eb-9cfe-afea41f9f772.png)

**To Reproduce**

Guessing its something to do with my project, happy to share access to it if it will help. Simply click on the "Content" menu item on the left within AdminUI.

**Expected behavior**

Haha, I'm not sure as I've never got it to work! I guess some sort of editor shows up :)

**Amplify CLI Version (if issue tied to Amplify CLI) **
You can use `amplify -v` to check the amplify cli version on your system
 - CLI Version 4.48
 - OS: Windows
 - Browser type (e.g. Google Chrome/ Firefox) Chrome

body: **Describe the bug** To be able to use Cognito with Alexa, we have to declare Alexa callback urls in cognito. If we used Admin UI, we are not able to add Alexa Redirect URLs (ex:https://layla.amazon.com/api/skill/link/MYID ) Alexa Urls can be add directly in Cognito via AWS Console Adding a / at the end won't work in alexa App. **Screenshots**

### Describe the bug

I want to delete this model 

![a12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8010129/114561797-79f91700-9ca0-11eb-8d47-62cab87df2f7.png)

Then I click `SAVE & DEPLOY` 
![a12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8010129/114561651-5504a400-9ca0-11eb-863a-c2525490b675.png)

Then the deployment status is KEEP IN PROGRESS like in picture  for 2 minutes , then it coming back, nothing is DELETE. 
![a12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8010129/114558130-f1c54280-9c9c-11eb-8209-8479f6868570.png)



![a12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8010129/114558478-48328100-9c9d-11eb-893d-06f2ae1a2d19.png)

Ok, then I try to delete in Amplify CLI 

1) I run this command to pull the env : amplify pull --appId SOMEID --envName dev
2) I delete `OrderProduct` model in `schema.graphql` 
3) amplify push 

Get this: 

![a12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8010129/114559043-e7f00f00-9c9d-11eb-8a7f-81879a978a7a.png)

Now I not able to add any new resource to the app. Cause everytime I run `amplify push` , I get the error above. 

So I thought wanna to stop the deployment in Cloudformation. 

All the stack is `UPDATE_COMPLETE `




### Expected behavior

1) Suppose delete a model in Amplify Admin, click "SAVE & DEPLOY" will delete the `OrderProducts` model in Amplify Admin UI  

2) Then amplify pull will update all my code `schema.graphql` which `OrderProducts` will deleted. 

3) Amplify push wont having this error. 

> A deployment is already in progress for the project, cannot push resources until it finishes.

In Amplify Admin show the Deployment is success, so update my code and `amplify push` wont have the error above, cause is doesnt make sense.

### Reproduction steps

1. In Amplify Admin, create 3 models. `OrderProducts`, `Order` , `Product`
2. OrderProduct 1 to 1 relationship with Order 
3. OrderProduct 1 to 1 relationship with Product 
4. Delete all the relationship, click Save & Deploy 
5. Delete OrderProduct relationship 
6. After deployment successful, `amplify pull --appId SOMEID --envName dev` in amplify CLI
7.  Now you notice, the OrderProduct still exists in `schema.graphql` 
8. Delete `OrderProduct` in `schema.graphql` 
9. run `amplify push` in cli 
10. Get this error 

> A deployment is already in progress for the project, cannot push resources until it finishes.




### Code Snippet

```javascript
// Put your code below this line.

```
// I cant delete OrderProduct
type OrderProduct @model @auth(rules: [{allow: private}]) {
  id: ID!
  Order: Order @connection
  Product: Product @connection
}

enum OrderStatus {
  PAID
  PAYLATER
}

type Order @model @auth(rules: [{allow: public, provider: iam, operations: [read, create]}]) @key(name: "byStore", fields: ["storeID"]) {
  id: ID!
  buyer_whatsapp_number: AWSPhone
  buyer_name: String
  order_total_amount: String
  order_status: OrderStatus
  storeID: ID
}


type Product @model @key(name: "byStore", fields: ["storeID"]) @auth(rules: [{allow: owner, operations: [create, update, delete]}, {allow: public, provider: iam, operations: [read]}]) {
  id: ID!
  product_name: String!
  product_price: String!
  created_at: AWSTimestamp
  product_short_id: String!
}

### Log output

```
Edit your schema at D:\Desktop\backend\api\coollinks\schema.graphql or place .graphql files in a directory at D:\Desktop\amplify\backend\api\coollinks\schema
A deployment is already in progress for the project, cannot push resources until it finishes.

```

Then I try to update other model as well 

I add relationship between `Order` and `Product` model for `1 to many relationship` as well. 

I get `Deployment success` like this:

![a12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8010129/114564757-3358ec00-9ca3-11eb-8b1f-60a8af2c2b36.png)

But when run `amplify pull --appId MYAPPID --envName dev`

Nothing is changes in Local `schema.graphql` (means no 1 to many relationship is added for Order and Product) 

Then I run `amplify push` to add edit it in local schema file, get this error: 

> A deployment is already in progress for the project, cannot push resources until it finishes.

Looks like, 
1) click "SAVE & DEPLOY" in Admin UI, didnt trigger the cloudformation update( cause status in cloudformation stack never change), 
2) But deployment success in Admin UI 
3) But in amplify cli when run `amplify push` , a deployment in progress

Now I cant amplify push anything, I cant update it in Admin ui, I just hang in between. 

Somebody please advise what I should do now.

@letsbelopez Sir this is the `Product` schema appear in my Admin UI 

![a12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8010129/114749609-b0f52880-9d85-11eb-83ee-a14d61a3befe.png)

1.  Dont have the field of `customerorderID`, I want to add the `customerorderID` in it, but when I `SAVE&DEPLOY` it revert my changes and the `customerorderID` disappear again. 
2.  After I `amplify pull` the environment, I didnt see `customerorderID` field in my local `schema.graphql` file 
3.  I cant edit in local `schema.graphql` file and `amplify push`, cause I have `deployment is already in progress error`

Therefore, is no any entry point that can let make changes. 

Is it possible for me to cancel the deployment that causing problem? should be this PR [#6990](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-cli/pull/6990) but dont know when it can be done. Cause in Amplify admin UI dont have any error shown. And I dont know what action I should take. 

Please advise

**Which Specific Feature is your question related to?**
Admin UI Auth Setup

**Provide additional details e.g. code snippets**
When setting up Authentication in the Admin UI, I want to use HTML for the forgot password message. When I add HTML and deploy, the forgot password message reverts to what had been saved earlier without HTML.

Can HTML be used to set custom message?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70524941/114197316-cb459580-9984-11eb-8cb5-96afc22c1411.png)
Im using  IotCore to upload deviceData and  in DynamoDB can found deviceData,but in Admin UI content ,the deviceData failed to sync

When creating models via the Admin UI, sometimes the screen becomes blank thereby losing all the models that had not been deployed. There should be a way to save draft models as draft so that in case you refresh the page, you will still find the draft models. Currently, on refreshing page, you lose all the models and start from where you last deployed.

body:
**Describe the bug**
The delete action in AdminUI content does not delete the record in DynamoDB, it just modifies a boolean flag. Which causes AppSync to crash when modifing Data Models Schemas.

**To Reproduce**
1. Create a Data Model
2. Insert data to the model
3. Delete the data within AdminUI Content.

**Expected behavior**
Deleted items within AdminUI content should be removed from the DynamoDB tables. 

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Amplify CLI Version (if issue tied to Amplify CLI) **
You can use `amplify -v` to check the amplify cli version on your system
 - CLI Version 4.46.1
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Node Version. 14.16.0
 - Browser type Google Chrome



**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior or terminal output if applicable

- In an empty directory, run `amplify pull --appId <validAppId> --envName <fakeEnvName>` 
- CLI admin login opens a browser window
- Redirect to environment selection
- select valid environment
- redirect to app homepage instead of verify page to authenticate Amplify CLI

**Describe the bug**
Deployment fails with models using different auth-providers

**To Reproduce**
Case 1) Article model schema needs auth as owner. Zone model schema doesnot require any specific auth role, so public auth is used. In this case apiKey is added thru "amplify update auth" for cognito user pool groups. With this setup **deployment fails** in console when Authorization mode is user-pool-groups. deployment succeeds with Authorization as API Key - but the appsync is failing to sync with cloud

Case 2) No auth described for Zone model, deployment succeeds, but **Content fails to load** with error "There was an error loading your data". screenshot attached

Case 3) User group is created and zone model schema @auth is attached to groups. Deployment succeeds. When running app, the **errors are** - adding confirmed user to group fails & later Lambda exception - Invalid JSON error

The above 3 cases are just samples.. It is difficult to build & run app with amplify

**Expected behavior**
If different models has different auth-providers like owner, apiKey.. then Deployment should not fail and many times there was no error stack to identify the cause of failure

**Screenshots**
added

**Amplify CLI Version (if issue tied to Amplify CLI) **
You can use `amplify -v` to check the amplify cli version on your system

 20.04

 - Browser type: Chrome

Creating an API silently fails without giving any reason.

**Describe the bug**
In my Amplify Admin UI, on my "dev" environment only, the content is not loading.

One Error in browser console:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36933715/113490215-9aff8200-94c0-11eb-871c-58aef15fb49c.png)

**To Reproduce**
Login to Amplify Admin UI > Navigate to "Content" (dev instance), in Chrome browser

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36933715/113489941-08121800-94bf-11eb-80b4-41fefbc0f8a2.png)

Observe infinite loading gif.

**Expected behavior**
I should be able to see at least three tables of information.

If I go directly to my DynamoDB table, I can see the 3 data rows as expected:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36933715/113490318-224cf580-94c1-11eb-81aa-48226cc658b9.png)


**Environment Details**
Chrome: Version 89.0.4389.114 (Official Build) (64-bit)
Amplify CLI: v4.45.2

**Attempts to fix**
1, Clear Chrome Browser Cache (via Chrome settings)
2. Empty Cache & Hard Reload (via Dev Tools)
3. Terminate all running Chrome sessions and reopen Admin UI

Works fine in FireFox:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36933715/113490176-6be91080-94c0-11eb-84d2-a2e3c245331f.png)

body: **Describe the bug** It seems that when I have the permissions on a table set to public (create, read, update, delete) I am able to manage content from the admin ui without issue, but if I turn off one of those flags (create or update) I can't edit content. You will get a red X error next to your item. **Expected behavior** This action should result in the content being properly updated. **Screenshots**

```graphql
type Todo
  @model

      { allow: owner, ownerField: "creator", operations: [create, read] }

        allow: groups
        groups: ["admins"]
        operations: [create, update, delete, read]
      }
      { allow: private, operations: [read] }
      { allow: public, provider: iam, operations: [read] }

}
```

**Describe the bug**
When using Manage Content with a model that has a boolean field in it a switch appears where you can choose true or false.  While you can change it to true and Save, it does not appear to change it in the database

On another note, glad to see this Manage Content section working at all!

I can't understand the relationship between the Admin UI Authentication panel and Cognito.

When updating the 'Data' section in Admin UI from API key to Cognito User Pool I expected all management of authentication to be handled solely from Cognito - however Admin UI's Authentication screen retains the same authentication view/options as before. It doesn't give any indication of what Cognito User Pool it is aligned to. I'd really appreciate if someone could explain what is going on?

As a part 2 to this question - if I create e.g user pool A initially, but then want to create user pool B and swap my react native application to use that pool B as opposed to A, how do I do that? I can't find any documentation/forum posts with an answer.

Thanks a mil for any help!

**Describe the bug**
When I pull a backend setup by Admin UI, that shows a login page and makes an error when proceed. The error message was “Failed to communicate with the Amplify CLI”.

**To Reproduce**
1. Finish tutorial on https://sandbox.amplifyapp.com/start#datastore
2. Login AWS management console
3. Move to Admin UI
4. Enable Auth from Admin UI
5. Run displayed amplify pull
6. Open browser and login via Admin UI
6. See the error

**Expected behavior**
Should success login.

**Screenshots**
![Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1716463/109735755-9a947280-7c06-11eb-8348-103b30ada878.JPG)

**Amplify CLI Version (if issue tied to Amplify CLI) **
You can use `amplify -v` to check the amplify cli version on your system
 - CLI Version: 4.44.2
 - OS: [e.g. Mac/Windows/Ubuntu]: Ubuntu on Windows with WSL2
 - Node Version: v14.15.4
 - Browser type: Chrome

**Additional context**
Related issue: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/issues/84. It seems that the login page makes a POST request to `http://127.0.0.1:4242/amplifyadmin/` while pull is running in a local console that makes an error. Looks like cross request between https and http, but need to deep dive to investigate.

comments.body: In addition, the POST request worked on macOS. I could confirm the issue happens only on Windows for now.

body: **Describe the bug** I am having an issue logging in to the Admin UI after initializing the back end environment for a project in AWS Amplify. The error message briefly says: "There were issues logging in. If this is a new app, please try again after a few minutes." I'm using a free tier AWS account. I tried to log in with my AWS credentials, but have had no luck. If I click "reset password" and enter my username, I never receive an email to reset the password (probably because it hasn't been set up). I first attempted to access the Admin UI last night on 2/16, and tried again this morning 2/17 with no luck. I also recently tried deleting the environment and starting from scratch, but had no success there either. In the console, a few error messages appear. I'm not sure how to address them. **To Reproduce** The issue appears when clicking "Open Admin UI" under Backend Environments. I had to enable pop-ups for the window to open. Though the documentation, to me, seems clear that it should automatically log me in using my AWS account for the first time. https://docs.amplify.aws/console/adminui/start The issue also appears when using the amplify CLI and running the `amplify pull --appId randomNumsLetters --envName staging` command from the Terminal. The webpage opens, but does not automatically log me in. **Expected behavior** I should be able to log in to the Admin UI and access the backend services for my new app. My project's name is Connecting-The-Beads. Does AWS Admin UI not like dashes or capital letters? **Screenshots** It shows this message for a fraction of a second. **Amplify CLI Version (if issue tied to Amplify CLI) ** - CLI Version: 4.43.0 - OS: macOS 10.14 - Node Version. 12.18.4 - Browser type: Google Chrome, Safari, Firefox Developer's Edition **Additional context** If I'm missing something obvious in the set up process, please let me know. I'm still new to AWS!

**Describe the bug**

It seems every time I make changes to AppSync via cli, things break with DataStore.

Case 1. Admin UI's Data section fails to load after updating AppSync's schema (schema.graphql) via amplify cli.
Case 2. One time, it completely disappeared and I had to re-enable the data model from Admin UI.
Case 3. After adding a new model to graphql.schema and amplify push, DataStore breaks.

Is it not an intended use? Should I never make changes to AppSync when using DataStore?

**To Reproduce**
1. Enable Admin UI and create a data model.
2. After the data mode gets deployed to the cloud, sync your local env => this should save graphql related files (e.g. schema.graphql)
3. Modify a model in schema.graphql - I added a @key directive like below
```
type Task
  @model
  @key(fields: ["username"])
  @auth(rules: [{ allow: owner, operations: [read, create, update, delete] }]) {
  id: ID!
  title: String!
  completionCount: Int!
  finished: Boolean
  username: String!
}
```
4. Admin UI's data section fails to load -> I checked console, and there were some js errors.

**Expected behavior**

Not sure what the intended behaviour should be.
Should I never make changes to AppSync when using DataStore?
Is it possible to use AppSync graphql api along with DataStore?

**Additional context**
aws-amplify: 3.3.14
amplify cli: 4.41.2

body:
**Describe the bug**
When I try to import an existing cognito pool into a project created through the new Admin UI, I hit role permission issues.

**To Reproduce**
I created an Application through the AWS console which led me to the Amplify Admin UI. Starting with an empty application, I added a simple test data model and performed a CLI pull to add the environment to my Javascript source tree using `amplify pull --appId <<APPID>> --envName staging`
From the CLI, after another `amplify pull` to verify I was up to date, I performed `amplify import auth` and received the following error:
```
amplify import auth
Using service: Cognito, provided by: awscloudformation
User: arn:aws:sts::<<AWS_ACCOUNT_ID>>:assumed-role/us-east-1_Spl8YeSn3_Full-access/amplifyadmin is not authorized to perform: cognito-idp:ListUserPools on resource: *
AccessDeniedException: User: arn:aws:sts::<<AWS_ACCOUNT_ID>>:assumed-role/us-east-1_Spl8YeSn3_Full-access/amplifyadmin is not authorized to perform: cognito-idp:ListUserPools on resource: *
    at Request.extractError (/Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/protocol/json.js:52:27)
    at Request.callListeners (/Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/sequential_executor.js:106:20)
    at Request.emit (/Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/sequential_executor.js:78:10)
    at Request.emit (/Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/request.js:688:14)
    at Request.transition (/Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/request.js:22:10)
    at AcceptorStateMachine.runTo (/Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/state_machine.js:14:12)
    at /Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/state_machine.js:26:10
    at Request.<anonymous> (/Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/request.js:38:9)
    at Request.<anonymous> (/Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/request.js:690:12)
    at Request.callListeners (/Users/dhagen/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/aws-sdk/lib/sequential_executor.js:116:18)
```
**Expected behavior**
Allow the importing of an existing AWS Cognito Pool into a new Amplify project.

**Amplify CLI Version (if issue tied to Amplify CLI) **
You can use `amplify -v` to check the amplify cli version on your system
 - CLI Version 4.41.1
 - OS: macOS
 - Node Version. v12.18.4
 - Browser type: Google Chrome

**Additional context**
It appears the IAM role deployed doesn't have the following permissions, which I validated by adding to the role that was generated and rerunning the command until it completed (in order that I hit them):
```
cognito-idp:ListUserPools on resource: *
cognito-idp:ListUserPoolClients on resource: *
cognito-idp:DescribeUserPoolClient on resource: *
cognito-identity:ListIdentityPools on resource: *
cognito-identity:DescribeIdentityPool on resource: *
cognito-idp:DescribeUserPool on resource: *
cognito-identity:GetIdentityPoolRoles on resource: *
cognito-idp:ListIdentityProviders on resource: *
```
Obviously, these could be more specific to the pools selected in the CLI, but in my case, I went with wildcards.

Manually designating arrays as non-nullable in GraphQL models breaks one-to-many relationships in Admin UI data modeling:

schema.graphql:

```
leaders: [Character]! @connection(keyName: "byDominion", fields: ["id"])
settlements: [Settlement!]! @connection(keyName: "byDominion", fields: ["id"])
```

Admin UI:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12061622/103454532-f50e6280-4c99-11eb-967f-793c57148db6.png)

If the arrays are allowed to be nullable, the one-to-many relationships are restored in Admin UI:

schema.graphql:

```
leaders: [Character] @connection(keyName: "byDominion", fields: ["id"])
settlements: [Settlement!] @connection(keyName: "byDominion", fields: ["id"])
```

Admin UI:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12061622/103454710-88946300-4c9b-11eb-8adf-87668220f8e2.png)

The instructions for creating a sample Amplify app are excellent, but they leave out one step.

On this page, https://sandbox.amplifyapp.com/test/ABCD1234, after step 3, the user should be told to add the files in `AWSAmplify/amplify/generated` to the project.

Otherwise, the line 
```
    let dataStorePlugin = AWSDataStorePlugin(modelRegistration: AmplifyModels())
```
will fail to compile with the error `Cannot find 'AmplifyModels' in scope`

ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65261123/xcode-project-fails-to-find-the-amplifymodels-file-that-is-generated-for-ios-p

i've tried this 2x
the first time i got a warning saying minimum password length is 6
the second time i somehow managed to make it deploy
this time i set password length to 0 and all requirements for password format off
the reason to do this is to enable password-less login
also because i saw the optional requirement of password in iOS SDK
i think it was my misunderstanding

so after i hit deploy
the authentication page was stuck on deploying for more than 6 hours
until i went to Cloud Formation
where i found the deployment has failed
i then deleted all the stacks there
now my entire Admin UI is deleted 😅

it was alright tho
i was being experimental there
still Admin UI is a tool i've missed for years for Amplify to have
hope this problem gets improved soon :)

Description
An angular app was created with amplify cli including api and auth. An attempt to add a table via the Amplify UI afterwards hangs on deployment.

To Reproduce
I followed this tutorial, ending on the Next Steps page.
https://docs.amplify.aws/start/getting-started/installation/q/integration/angular#install-and-configure-the-amplify-cli
When opening the amplify console I went to the presented Amplify UI option.
Defined a new table and hit deploy, which prompted to enable data store and deploy.
Getting a Deployment Status In progress message for over 6 hours at this point. Final status says UPDATE_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE in red and no reason is listed.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6631881/101581557-b80bc480-39a8-11eb-8667-38f8c4f3bb7f.png)

Environment
Windows 10 Home build 19042.630
npm listing attached
[npm_list.txt](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-adminui/files/5663447/npm_list.txt)

**Describe the bug**
When I open the new Amplify Admin UI on the console I can go to the user management section, to Authentication, to GraphQL API, and so on...
All of them are loading fine.
However, the `Content` never leaves the state of "Fetching items", I had let it run for several minutes, no signal of finishing load the items, neither an error message is displayed.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Amplify Admin UI
2. Click on Content on the left sidebar
3. Wait forever for the fetching items to finish
4. No way to select a table on the drop-down menu at the top, it is disabled.

**Expected behavior**
It should finish loading the data related to the app content or show a clear error message

**Screenshots**
https://imgur.com/fExsOBl

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: OSX
 - Browser Firefox 
 - Version 83.0

body:
It is important for me to be aware of resources added to my account and there is necessary bookkeeping involved to ensure only approved resources are created. In other AWS services, if I used the console to configure a service, the console will inform me of any resources that will be created on my behalf and I can properly document them.  As we know, there are not many good “discovery tools” to retroactively find these resources.

Turning on The admin UI has created a number of resources in my behalf, and it has not informed me of this behaviour. I have found new Cognito user pools, roles, and lambda functions created. 

I would like these resources to be listed and my consent given via a checkbox before creating these resources.
